intro: Elleanthus congestus, commonly known as the clustered elleanthus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters, giving it a compact appearance. Elleanthus congestus is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
